entry.tran: (对建筑物或土地的)终身保有权
entry.def: If you have the freehold of a building or piece of land, it is yours for life and there are no conditions regarding your ownership.

example.ex: People owning leasehold homes will be given a new right to buy the freehold of their property.
example.tran: 房屋租赁者将获得购买所住房产终身保有权的新权利。

entry.tran: （建筑物或土地）可终身保有的
entry.def: If a building or piece of land is freehold, you can own it for life.

example.ex: The property register will also say whether the property is freehold or leasehold.
example.tran: 房产注册簿上也会说明房产是终身保有的还是租借的。

means.word_mean: 1. an estate held in fee simple or for life
2. tenure by which land is held in fee simple or for life
